This API supports the OAuth client credentials grant type as described in RFC 6749.

Most APIs require a Bearer token to be submitted in order to determine the calling user's identity and permissions. Call this endpoint with your user's basic authentication credentials to retrieve its Bearer token.
If your organization uses two-factor authentication for local users, you must also include a totp-auth header value containing the Time-based One-Time Password (TOTP).

post.summary: Search for audit events
post.description:
General purpose audit-log search. All parameters are optional. A search with no arguments returns all events to which the searching user has access.

A search with multiple values for a single parameter applies "or" logic for that parameter. e.g. Searching for "actor_name=[alice@example.com, bob@example.com]" finds events for which either alice or bob was the actor.

A search with multiple parameters applies "and" logic between parameters. e.g. Searching for "event_type=user_registered,actor_name=alice@example.com" finds user_registered events for which alice@example.com was the actor.

post.summary: Get the number of events matching a search
post.description: Returns the count of events found in a search with identical parameters and at the same time. Parameters follow an identical behavior for this results count query, as they would the audit-log search query.

post.summary: Search for audit events, specifically for large result sets
post.description: Audit-log search, parameters follow an identical behavior for this results count query, as they would the general purpose audit-log search query.

Uses the given filters and updates a batch of matching alerts to the given state.

agentTimestamp.title: Date and time that the Code42 service on the device detected an event; based on the device's system clock and reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

eventAction.title: The type of file event observed. For example: file-modified, application-read, removable-media-created.

eventId.title: The unique identifier for the event.

fileName.title: The name of the file, including the file extension.

md5.title: The MD5 hash of the file contents.

sourceAccountName.title: For cloud sync apps installed on user devices, the name of the cloud account where the event was observed. This can help identify if the activity occurred in a business or personal account.

sourceAccountType.title: For cloud sync apps installed on user devices, the type of account where the event was observed. For example, 'BUSINESS' or 'PERSONAL'.

sourceCategory.title: General category of where the file originated. For example: Cloud Storage, Email, Social Media.

items.title: The domain section of the URLs reported in file.acquiredFrom.tabs.url.

sourceDomains.title: The domain section of the URLs reported in file.acquiredFrom.tabs.url.

sourceName.title: The name reported by the device's operating system.  This may be different than the device name in the Code42 console.

tabs.title: Metadata about the browser tab source.

userEmail.title: The Code42 username used to sign in to the Code42 app on the device (for endpoint events) or the cloud service username of the person who caused the event (for cloud events).

AcquiredFrom-file-events.title: List of other events associated with this file. This can help determine the origin of the file.

repositoryEmail.title: The email address specified by the user who performed the Git event. This is a user-defined value and may differ from the credentials used to sign in to Git.

repositoryUri.title: Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the Git repository.

repositoryUser.title: The username specified by the user who performed the Git event. This is a user-defined value and may differ from the credentials used to sign in to Git.

AcquiredFromGit-file-events.title: Metadata about the Git activity associated with this event.

items.title: For endpoint events where a file in cloud storage is synced to a device, the email address of the user logged in to the cloud storage provider.

email.title: For endpoint events where a file in cloud storage is synced to a device, the email address of the user logged in to the cloud storage provider.

accountName.title: For cloud sync apps installed on user devices, the name of the cloud account where the event was observed. This can help identify if the activity occurred in a business or personal account.

accountType.title: For cloud sync apps installed on user devices, the type of account where the event was observed. For example, 'BUSINESS' or 'PERSONAL'.

category.title: General category of where the file originated. For example: Cloud Storage, Email, Social Media.

items.title: The domain section of the URLs reported in destination.tabs.url.

domains.title: The domain section of the URLs reported in destination.tabs.url.

ip.title: The external IP address of the user's device.

name.title: The name reported by the device's operating system.  This may be different than the device name in the Code42 console.

operatingSystem.title: The operating system of the destination device.

printJobName.title: For print events, the name of the print job, as reported by the user's device.

printerName.title: For print events, the name of the printer the job was sent to.

items.title: The IP address of the user's device on your internal network, including Network interfaces, Virtual Network Interface controllers (NICs), and Loopback/non-routable addresses.

privateIp.title: The IP address of the user's device on your internal network, including Network interfaces, Virtual Network Interface controllers (NICs), and Loopback/non-routable addresses.

remoteHostname.title: For events where a file transfer tool was used, the destination hostname.

tabs.title: Metadata about the browser tab destination.

Destination-file-events.title: Metadata about the destination of the file event.

items.title: The email addresses of those who received the email. Includes the To, Cc, and Bcc recipients.

recipients.title: The email addresses of those who received the email. Includes the To, Cc, and Bcc recipients.

subject.title: The subject of the email message.

items.title: For endpoint events where a file in cloud storage is synced to a device, the email address of the user logged in to the cloud storage provider. For cloud events, the email addresses of users added as sharing recipients. In some case, OneDrive events may return multiple values, but this is often the same username formatted in different ways.

email.title: For endpoint events where a file in cloud storage is synced to a device, the email address of the user logged in to the cloud storage provider. For cloud events, the email addresses of users added as sharing recipients. In some case, OneDrive events may return multiple values, but this is often the same username formatted in different ways.

action.title: The type of file event observed. For example: file-modified, application-read, removable-media-created.

detectorDisplayName.title: Indicates the name you provided when the cloud data connection was initially configured in the Code42 console.

id.title: The unique identifier for the event.

ingested.title: Date and time the event was initially received by Code42; timestamp is based on the Code42 server system clock and reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

inserted.title: Date and time the event processing is completed by Code42; timestamp is based on the Code42 server system clock and reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Typically occurs very soon after the event.ingested time.

observer.title: The data source that captured the file event. For example: GoogleDrive, Office365, Salesforce.

items.title: Sharing types added by this event.

shareType.title: Sharing types added by this event.

vector.title: The method of file movement. For example: UPLOADED, DOWNLOADED, EMAILED.

items.title: Which columns to include in the output. If none is provided, all available columnswill be output in an unspecified, not-guaranteed order.

columns.title: Which columns to include in the output. If none is provided, all available columnswill be output in an unspecified, not-guaranteed order.

groupClause.title: Grouping clause for any specified groups.

groups.title: One or more FilterGroups to be combined in a query.

items.title: Which columns to include in the output. If none is provided, all available columnswill be output in an unspecified, not-guaranteed order.

columns.title: Which columns to include in the output. If none is provided, all available columnswill be output in an unspecified, not-guaranteed order.

groupClause.title: Grouping clause for any specified groups.

groups.title: One or more FilterGroups to be combined in a query.

browser.title: The web browser in which the event occurred.

loggedInUser.title: The user logged in to the web browser when the event occurred.

version.title: The version of the Code42 Incydr extension installed when the event occurred.

Extension-file-events.title: Metadata about the Code42 browser extension to facilitate troubleshooting.

error.title: Error indicating why the field could not be determined.

field.title: FileEvent field that could not be determined.

FieldError-file-events.title: List fields with errors indicating why they could not be determined.

acquiredFrom.title: List of other events associated with this file. This can help determine the origin of the file.

archiveId.title: Unique identifier for files identified as an archive, such as .zip files.

category.title: A categorization of the file that is inferred from MIME type.

changeType.title: The action that caused the event. For example: CREATED, MODIFIED, DELETED.

classifications.title: Data provided by an external file classification vendor.

cloudDriveId.title: Unique identifier reported by the cloud provider for the drive containing the file at the time the event occurred.

created.title: File creation timestamp as reported by the device's operating system in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC); available for Mac and Windows NTFS devices only.

directory.title: The file location on the user's device; a forward or backslash must be included at the end of the filepath. Possibly null if the file event occurred on a cloud provider.

items.title: Unique identifiers of the parent drives that contain the file; searching on directoryId will return events for all of the files contained in the parent drive.

directoryId.title: Unique identifiers of the parent drives that contain the file; searching on directoryId will return events for all of the files contained in the parent drive.

id.title: Unique identifier reported by the cloud provider for the file associated with the event.

mimeType.title: The MIME type of the file. For endpoint events, if the mimeTypeByBytes differs from mimeTypeByExtension, this indicates the most likely MIME type for the file. For activity observed by a web browser, this is the only MIME type reported.

mimeTypeByBytes.title: The MIME type of the file based on its contents.

mimeTypeByExtension.title: The MIME type of the file based on its extension.

modified.title: File modification timestamp as reported by the device's operating system.  This only indicates changes to file contents.  Changes to file permissions, file owner, or other metadata are not reflected in this timestamp.  Date is reported in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

name.title: The name of the file, including the file extension.

originalDirectory.title: The original file location on the user's device or cloud service location; a forward or backslash must be included at the end of the filepath. Possibly null if the file event occurred on a cloud provider.

originalName.title: The original name of the file, including the file extension.

type.description:
Below you will find specific activity actions supported for each trusted activity type.

|  Action / Type  | `ACCOUNT_NAME` | `DOMAIN` | `GIT_REPOSITORY_URI` | `SLACK` | `URL_PATH` |
|:---------------:|:--------------:|:--------:|:--------------------:|:-------:|------------|
| `CLOUD_SHARE`   |                |     ✓    |                      |         |            |
| `CLOUD_SYNC`    |        ✓       |     ✓    |                      |         |            |
| `EMAIL`         |                |     ✓    |                      |         |            |
| `FILE_TRANSFER` |                |     ✓    |                      |         |            |
| `FILE_UPLOAD`   |                |     ✓    |                      |         |            |
| `GIT_PUSH`      |                |     ✓    |           ✓          |         |            |

Note: Trusted activity types `SLACK` and `URL_PATH` do not support any activity action defintion. 
For these trusted activity types, simply pass an empty array for activityActions.

ActivityActionProvider-trusted-activitie.description: An Activity Action Provider associated with an activity action.

name.description:
The only two Trusted Activity Types that support specific providers are `DOMAIN` and `ACCOUNT_NAME`.

Below you will find specific providers for each action supported by the `DOMAIN` and `ACCOUNT_NAME` types. 
If no providers are listed for a particular action, it means that no specific providers are required for that action type. 
Pass an empty array for providers. 

Providers for each action supported by the `DOMAIN` type:

| Provider / Action | `CLOUD_SHARE` | `CLOUD_SYNC` | `EMAIL` | `FILE_UPLOAD` | `GIT_PUSH` |
|:-----------------:|:-------------:|:------------:|:-------:|:-------------:|:----------:|
|       `BOX`       |       ✓       |       ✓      |         |               |            |
|     `DROPBOX`     |               |              |         |               |            |
|   `GOOGLE_DRIVE`  |       ✓       |       ✓      |         |               |            |
|      `GMAIL`      |               |              |    ✓    |               |            |
|      `ICLOUD`     |               |       ✓      |         |               |            |
|    `OFFICE_365`   |               |              |    ✓    |               |            |
|    `ONE_DRIVE`    |       ✓       |       ✓      |         |               |            |

Providers for each action supported by the `ACCOUNT_NAME` type:

| Provider / Action | `CLOUD_SYNC` |
|:-----------------:|:------------:|
|      `ICLOUD`     |              |
|       `BOX`       |              |
|     `DROPBOX`     |       ✓      |
|   `GOOGLE_DRIVE`  |              |
|      `GMAIL`      |              |
|    `OFFICE_365`   |              |
|    `ONE_DRIVE`    |       ✓      |

totalCount.description: The total count of TrustedActivityResponse objects returned.

activityActionGroups.description:
The collection of activity action groups the associated trusted activity applies to. 
Below you will find specific requirements for each trusted activity type.
- `DOMAIN` - If no activity action group is provided, the default will be assigned implicitly. Else; the supplied groups will be applied, and override any existing configuration. 
- `ACCOUNT_NAME` - At least one activity action group is required. On update, The supplied groups will be applied, and override any existing configuration.
- `GIT_REPOSITORY_URI` - At least one activity action group is required. On update, The supplied groups will be applied, and override any existing configuration.
- `SLACK` - No activity action groups are allowed - array must be empty.
- `URL_PATH` - No activity action groups are allowed - array must be empty.

description.description: A description of the trusted activity.

isHighValueSource.description:
Indicates if the resource is a high value source of company information. If true, a source risk indicator is 
applied to events for files downloaded from this location and later uploaded to an untrusted destination.
### Supported trusted activity types

- `DOMAIN`
- `SLACK`
- `URL_PATH`
- `ACCOUNT_NAME`
- `GIT_REPOSITORY_URI`

Note: When updating a resource, if the `isHighValueSource` property is not explicitly set, the existing value
of the property remains unchanged.

status.title:
Indicates the status of the case.
OPEN: The case is active and all aspects of the case are editable.
CLOSED: The case is resolved. Closed cases cannot be re-opened or modified. Case data for closed cases is retained indefinitely.
ARCHIVED: The case is no longer active. File events and file contents are permanently deleted and no longer accessible. Archived cases cannot be un-archived or modified.

term.description:
The alert or rule metadata attribute to search on.

For alert queries, value must be one of: AlertId, TenantId, Type, Name, Description, Actor, ActorId, Target, RiskSeverity, RuleSource, CreatedAt, Observations, Notes, Watchlists, HasAuthSignificantWatchlist, State, StateLastModifiedAt, StateLastModifiedBy, LastModifiedTime, LastModifiedBy, RuleId, Education, Severity.

For rule queries, value must be one of RuleMetadataId, TenantId, ObserverRuleId, Type, Name, Description, IsEnabled, ModifiedAt, ModifiedBy, CreatedAt, CreatedBy, RuleWarning, LogString.
